All Classes

Class Description
AntiFlagModeGame
Game Mode: Users cannot flag
AtomicModeGame
Game Mode: Un-flagged bombs continually explode with a set time interval, scrambling and undoing nearby progress
AutomatedBoardModeGame
Game Mode: Cells of the board reveal themselves with a set time interval, having a 5% chance of being a bomb
BoardGUI
Handler for all board GUI functionality
BuildAWallModeGame
Game Mode: Cells which are not bombs are "walled" with a set time interval, allowing less easy progress
ClimateChangeModeGame
Game Mode: Board changes shapes every move, between square and hexagon
ControlPanelGUI
Handler for all control panel GUI functionality
CrazyHouseModeGame
Game Mode: Board scrambles all unvisited cells after each move
Game
Abstract class to handle all gameplay
GameStatus
Stores the status of the game
Global
Stores all variables which must be accessed by all classes
HexagonBoard
The board which handles hexagonal placements and neighbors
HexagonBoardGUI
Board GUI to handle hexagonal labels and layout
HexagonLabel
Class to handle hexagonal labels
HexagonLayout
Handles the layout of all hexagonal labels for the board
IconHandler
Handles translating strings to icons (images) from files
Main
Driver class to run to play the game
MinesweeperBoard
The board which handles generic placements and neighbors, abstracted to allow for different board shapes
MinesweeperGUI
Overall GUI handler for entire screen
MineTickModeGame
Game Mode: A mine is added to the board each time the user makes a move
NormalModeGame
Game Mode: Classic minesweeper
SquareBoard
The board which handles square placements and neighbors
SquareBoardGUI
Board GUI to handle square labels and layout
Test
Class to run unit tests from
TriangleBoard
The board which handles triangular placements and neighbors
TriangleBoardGUI
Board GUI to handle triangular labels and layout
TriangleLayout
Handles the layout of all triangular labels for the board
TriangleLeftLabel
Class to handle left-sided triangular labels
TriangleRightLabel
Class to handle right-sided triangle labels
UnitTest
Abstract class to be overridden with various different games to test on
